author: Robert Iafolla
title: Judge gives preliminary approval to Kellogg's $16.8 mln wage settlement
text:
A federal judge in Washington State has preliminarily approved a $16.8 million settlement to resolve a wage-and-hour lawsuit accusing Kellogg Co of failing to pay certain managers and retail store representatives the overtime wages they were owed.
U.S. District Judge Ronald Leighton in Tacoma said in an order on Wednesday that the settlement appeared to be fair and reasonable. He scheduled a May hearing to consider final approval.
To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2GEKneA
